group_1.narration: My dream came true and I was assigned@to work for the royal family.
The days of serving Queen Cleopatra,@who I admired so deeply, had begun.

group_1.textRight: Have you heard?
What?
It's about Master Antonius.
From what I gather, a clash between him@and Octavius has become inevitable...
Yes…
I myself have heard that the Romans@despise the queen...
In their words, she is a wicked woman who seduced@Antonius and stole him away from his Roman wife...
…Is that right?
It's what they say…
People claim Octavius's underlings are@promoting that sentiment…
Our country has been pulled into a power@struggle between the Romans…
We had it coming. Queen Cleopatra took far@too much advantage of Rome, after all.
…Hm. Wait a second.
…You there. Looking for something?
Is that so? Off with you, then.
His reputation has fallen quite far, huh…?
Quite indeed.
Master Antonius is now utterly disgraced@in Rome.
None of this would have happened@had he not met Cleopatra…
I suppose…
Why don't you return to Rome as well?
…Work is favorable here.
I'm certain that Octavius will declare war…!
Don't you see that this place will become@a battlefield?
Is that…fate?
Yes.
And while it may offend you, I must add...
I don't trust these Egyptians.
We clash with them on a fundamental level.
And the one responsible for that conflict is@Cleopatra herself…
She brings misery to all…even Caesar…

group_1.narration: Ever since I joined the dynasty,@I've been hearing these sorts of stories.
Having been educated in an environment@that put the dynasty above all else,@I was outraged by these insults@to Queen Cleopatra.
At first, my rage poured out in every bit of@my manner of conduct with others,
but as I worked by Queen Cleopatra's side…
